Tabulate categorical variables with proportions

Source: R/tabulate.R
tab_cat_prop.Rd

Tabulate categorical variables with proportions

Usage

tab_cat_prop(
  data,
  yvars = NULL,
  xvars = NULL,
  var_labels = 2,
  val_labels = FALSE,
  prop = TRUE,
  prefix = "v",
  na.rm.yvar = FALSE,
  na.rm.xvar = FALSE
)

Arguments

data

data.frame with only variables you want included.

yvars

Dependent variable, as string.

xvars

Optional independent variable, as string.

var_labels

Integer, 0=variable name, 1=variable name - variable label, 2=variable label.

val_labels

Logical, whether to use value labels as column names in output.

prop

Logical, whether to compute proportions (default), or n_observations.

prefix

Prefix to frequency variables in output.

na.rm.yvar

Remove missing in dependent variable? Defaults to false.

na.rm.xvar

Remove missing in independent variable? Defaults to false.

Value

data.frame with some fixed columns

Examples

tab_cat_prop(ex_survey1[,paste0("b_", 1:3)])
#> # A tibble: 9 × 7
#>   yvar  yvar_group yvar_part yvar_cat      .n yvar_group_label           yvar_…¹
#>   <chr> <chr>      <chr>     <fct>      <dbl> <chr>                      <chr>  
#> 1 b_1   b          1         Not at all  0.55 How much do you like livi… Bejing 
#> 2 b_1   b          1         A bit       0.37 How much do you like livi… Bejing 
#> 3 b_1   b          1         A lot       0.08 How much do you like livi… Bejing 
#> 4 b_2   b          2         Not at all  0.4  How much do you like livi… Brusse…
#> 5 b_2   b          2         A bit       0.48 How much do you like livi… Brusse…
#> 6 b_2   b          2         A lot       0.12 How much do you like livi… Brusse…
#> 7 b_3   b          3         Not at all  0.45 How much do you like livi… Budape…
#> 8 b_3   b          3         A bit       0.42 How much do you like livi… Budape…
#> 9 b_3   b          3         A lot       0.13 How much do you like livi… Budape…
#> # … with abbreviated variable name ¹​yvar_part_label
tab_cat_prop(ex_survey1, xvars = "x1_sex", yvars = paste0("b_", 1:3))
